org.ftccommunity.ftcxtensible.robot

Class Watchdog

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ftccommunity.ftcxtensible.robot.Watchdog

  • public class Watchdog
extends java.lang.Object
    A Watchdog representation for OpModes that allows for synchronisation across multiple OpModes
    Since:
    0.3.1
    Author:
    David Sargent

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Watchdog()
      Creates a new Watchdog, with one lock aviabable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean exceptionCaught()
      Returns true if an exception has been caught and this Watchdog notified of the exception
      java.lang.Throwable getException()
      Gets the current exception that should be processed, if none is present this returns null
      boolean lock()
      Locks the current Watchdog, if the lock cannot be acquired in 500 milliseconds the attempt to lock fails and the the function returns false, otherwise true is returned
      void setException(java.lang.Throwable ex)
      Records the thrown exception for later processing
      void unlock()
      Unlocks this Watchdog

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Watchdog

        public Watchdog()
        Creates a new Watchdog, with one lock aviabable

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        public boolean lock()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Locks the current Watchdog, if the lock cannot be acquired in 500 milliseconds the attempt to lock fails and the the function returns false, otherwise true is returned
        Returns:
        whether the lock was obtained or not
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Unlocks this Watchdog

      • getException

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Throwable getException()
        Gets the current exception that should be processed, if none is present this returns null
        Returns:
        the current exception or null

      • setException

        public void setException(@NotNull
                         java.lang.Throwable ex)
        Records the thrown exception for later processing
        Parameters:
        ex - the thrown exception to be caught
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the Throwable was null

      • exceptionCaught

        public boolean exceptionCaught()
        Returns true if an exception has been caught and this Watchdog notified of the exception
        Returns:
        if this Watchdog has an exception
